name: Courtyard King Kamehameha's Kona Beach Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at king Kam for 6 nights. Loved the location close to shops and restaurants. The hotel has done some nice updates and the wifi was decent. The computer facilities were top notch. Thought the service at the desk was pretty good and maid service was above normal. Rooms a bit small but nice lanai with table and chairs. Parking 10 a day bit steep. Restaurant hannu was ok but closed early but quite normal for kona. Pool was small and u had to get up early to get a chair. The beach is good for kona because beaches are scarce in the area. Snorkeling and paddle boarding is great there. Not sure I will return but won't rule it out.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The first thing they don't tell you about this hotel is that it's a Courtyard Marriott. Do not mistake it for anything more than a 3-star hotel. They give you a room key and then you're on your own. The rooms are very standard and maid service is sporatic. Our first 2 days they cleaned our room while we were on a morning excursion, but a few days into the trip we had to beg the front desk for new towels after 2pm. Bar service at the pool was a joke. No drinks allowed beyond the bar (ie not it the pool or jacuzzi or by the beach) so you have to finish your drink in your wet clothes and then go back. It's too chilly in december for those rules! But they ignore rules like no one under 15 allowed in the hottub without supervision. Several times we were smothered with unsupervised 5-year-olds partying it up in the hot tub. To sum up, it's clean and convenient but not a full-service hotel. It should be cheaper for the lack of service. Not horrific, but definitely not nice.
reviews.title: Terrible service. For the budget traveler only.

reviews.text: The rooms were nice, clean, but definitely not large. The hotel is located right in downtown Kailua-Kona making it a GREAT location.
reviews.title: Updated Hotel that but Not Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has gone through a recent remodel, but I have to wonder who was hired to do the job. Lobby looks nice, but a lot of the room and hall work looks shoddy and already in need of some TLC. When we checked in we had some problems, dirty bedspread, tv that didn't work and the need for the maintanece man to show up twice in one evening. We were offered another room, but the view was worse and dedcided to stay put. No comp for the problems we did have which I always think is necessary when problems arrise like this the first day! Like other post state, the bathroom is small and you may not think its a big deal, but it is when only one person can fit at a time and you are trying to get ready. Besides the above issue the hotel is located in a great location. You are right downtown in Kailiua and walking distance to many shops, stores and resturants. Downtown has it all. We spent 7 nights during Christmas and enjoyed the walks into town on the boardwalk and all the fun little shops. However, the hotel beach is really not! Need a car to go to the nice beaches of Kona and there are many. My suggestion is get to the beach early so parking and beach space is not a problem, by 11:00 things begin to get crowded. Loved the Fish Hopper Resturant for their pulled pork!
reviews.title: Great Location Average stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The remodeled rooms are very nice. Even the air ducts are clean. The bed linens were also clean and new. The bathroom lacks an adequate amount of towel racks and the shower head holder constantly slipped causing aggravation while showering. There is a safe in room. In-room refrigerator stocked with $3 water. Free wi-fi with a signal too weak to be usable in the room. The wi-fi would not work anywhere in hotel and I had no problems at other hotels.
reviews.title: Remodeled rooms are the only plus
Great Location for exploring Kailua
reviews.text: Hotel is located right in downtown Kailua, but with the convienence of in and out privileges at the hotel parking lot for being a guest. Hotel staff was friendly, and so many restuarants and shops within walking distance, including Kona Brewing Co. Initially picked this hotel because it said it was on the beach, but the beach is small and we instead decided to drive out of town to explore other beaches on the big island. Despite this, we would definitely stay there again. Lunch by the pool was nice overlooking the bay.

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights here at the beginning of January and felt so lucky to have chosen such a lovely place to stay!
reviews.title: Great Location, Fantastic stay

reviews.text: We hadnt upgraded but still had great views (just beware because EVERYONE can see into your room! - keep the shutters closed when changing!) The room was a great size with a fridge and safe, and a lovely bathroom.
reviews.title: Fantastic location
Big Disappointment.....
reviews.text: This one night stay was a fiasco with 2 room changes, and a big letdown after a wonderful vacation on the Big Island. I reserved and prepaid for a room with a king sized bed and an oceanview for our last night in Hawaii. What we found when we got in the room was 2 smaller beds and no water view. The front desk said "You don't get a view if you use your AAA card"...but this is exactly what I paid UP for, an upgraded room. Wanting this to be a special night, we asked to move, they had us wait 30 minutes until they could give us another room~ this next room had the king bed and the view but also a horrible screeching sound from inside the wall (sounding like a broken fan belt or something, ear plugs wouldn't have been good enough). Next room, king bed with no view but QUIET which is all we cared about after lugging our suitcases down to the lobby twice. The staff seemed way understaffed and stressed out, not their fault. The manager did comp us breakfast for our troubles, and that was really wonderful....that atmosphere was lovely and the food was delicious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel lobby has a convention hotel type of feel, and with our disappointing experience I'd say find another place to stay. Seriously.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.text: I agree with the previous reviews that this hotel is in a great location and great value. No, it is not one of the big luxury resorts. However, it is in one of the best locations as you can walk to all of the restaurants and shops in Kona---a beautiful walk along the coast. With the luxury resorts, you have to drive a good distance everywhere. The pool area and beach are quite nice. The rooms were just okay in size but very clean. The resort---lobby, art gallery, pool area, restaurant---are nicely done. The ABS store on the premises was very convenient. The only reason I didn't give this hotel a 5 star/excellent rating is that I found it quite lacking in the "aloha" spirit. The front desk staff didn't seem to be concerned at all that we didn't get the room we booked (we ended with 2 queens instead of a kind for our 10th anniversary). The only response we got was you aren't guaranteed a type of room. Really? Also, sometimes the service around the pool bar and in the restaraunt was sketchy....the staff seemed stressed. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this place for the price. Again, not one of the luxury resorts but nor are you paying the price for that. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Will never come back

reviews.text: We will never come back to this hotel. Lobby had a terrible odor of urine. When we checked in we had to switch rooms twice. The air conditioning was not working in the first room, and there was sewage back up in the bathtub of the second room. Very frustrating after a long trip. The internet was slow and did not work half the time. There are only 3 washing machines for the entire hotel of 450 rooms. I went to the laundry room on numerous occasions and either had to wait a LONG time, not do the laundry or go to a laundry mat across the street. The service in the restaurant was horrible. I could never get coffee with the breakfast buffet, so started making coffee in the room and bringing it down to breakfast. Often got our own water because no one waited on us. The desk staff was friendly and helpful but the concierge was not and the people in the mail (ship and pack) place in the hotel were down right rude. It was a waste of 2 weeks in Hawaii and we will never stay there or recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: great hotel for tourists

reviews.text: Great value- very clean, friendly staff and great location.
reviews.title: Great location and value.

reviews.text: There are many luxury hotels in Kona; this is not one of them and one should not expect the same as a luxury hotel. Marriott took over the old King Kam and redid it after the tsunami. Large rooms with a medium size refrigerator (no freezer section though) and a small balcony. Excellent beds and, for a business traveler, a nice desk with fast wifi and a safe large enough for a laptop. Small bathroom if you have four people to a room though. This is a great location, close to the pier where many tours leave from. There is a ABC convenience store at the hotel and a laundry room (get quarters from front desk). The pool is nice, but every time I was there it was overrun with kids in morning and afternoon. Not as crowded at night.
reviews.title: Great location and good value

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and rather pretty; there was a wonderful high definition television, a mini fridge, a nice little lanai with a pretty ocean view,and very comfortable beds! The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The pool was magnificent (newly renovated after the Tsunami) with a great hot tub as well. There was live music out by the pool that was pleasing and not too loud. There were plenty of shops, restaurants and sights within walking distance of the hotel. The only negative (and it a rather big one) is that the new Honu restaurant had one of the worst service experiences I have ever had, and most of the people there would tell you the same; I can go on about the faults, but need I say more we waited at our table for over an hour for our food (that never came). When I go back to Kona, I will most likely stay at the Hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a Great Price

description: Hotel and restaurants newly renovated in 2011. All 452 rooms have been upgraded which feature complimentary high speed Internet access, private balconies, mini refrigerator, coffee maker with complimentary Kona Coffee, 37' color flat screen television and complimentary in-room safe. You’ll experience a brand new hotel from the moment you step into the new lobby. You’ll also find completely renovated corridors, business center, meeting rooms, outdoor swimming pool and whirlpool and a 24-hour complimentary guest fitness center.
